verses.roman:
dṛṣṭvā bhrātṛ-vadhodyogaṁ
rukmiṇī bhaya-vihvalā
patitvā pādayor bhartur
uvāca karuṇaṁ satī

synonyms: dṛṣṭvā—seeing; bhrātṛ—her brother; vadha—to kill; udyogam—the attempt; rukmiṇī—Śrīmatī Rukmiṇī; bhaya—by fear; vihvalā—agitated; patitvā—falling; pādayoḥ—at the feet; bhartuḥ—of her husband; uvāca—spoke; karuṇam—pathetically; satī—saintly.
translation: Seeing Lord Kṛṣṇa ready to kill her brother, saintly Rukmiṇī was filled with alarm. She fell at her husband's feet and piteously spoke as follows.
